trans-unit.target: Introduction to Application Gateway | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This page provides an overview of the Application Gateway service for layer 7 load balancing, including gateway sizes, HTTP load balancing, cookie based session affinity, and SSL offload.
trans-unit.target: This page provides an overview of the Application Gateway service for layer 7 load balancing, including gateway sizes, HTTP load balancing, cookie based session affinity, and SSL offload.

trans-unit.source: What is Application Gateway?
trans-unit.target: What is Application Gateway?

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Application Gateway provides an Azure-managed HTTP load balancing solution based on layer 7 load balancing.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Application Gateway provides an Azure-managed HTTP load balancing solution based on layer 7 load balancing.

trans-unit.source: Application load balancing enables IT administrators and developers to create routing rules for network traffic based on HTTP.
trans-unit.target: Application load balancing enables IT administrators and developers to create routing rules for network traffic based on HTTP.

trans-unit.source: The application gateway service is highly available and metered.
trans-unit.target: The application gateway service is highly available and metered.

trans-unit.source: For the SLA and Pricing, please refer to the [SLA](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/sla/) and [Pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/application-gateway/) pages.
trans-unit.target: For the SLA and Pricing, please refer to the [SLA](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/sla/) and [Pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/application-gateway/) pages.

trans-unit.source: HTTP layer 7 load balancing
trans-unit.target: HTTP layer 7 load balancing

trans-unit.source: Azure provides layer 4 load balancing via Azure load balancer working at the transport level (TCP/UDP) and having all incoming network traffic being load balanced to the App Gateway service.
trans-unit.target: Azure provides layer 4 load balancing via Azure load balancer working at the transport level (TCP/UDP) and having all incoming network traffic being load balanced to the App Gateway service.

trans-unit.source: The Application Gateway then will apply the routing rules to HTTP traffic, providing level 7 (HTTP) load balancing.
trans-unit.target: The Application Gateway then will apply the routing rules to HTTP traffic, providing level 7 (HTTP) load balancing.

trans-unit.source: When you create an Application Gateway, an endpoint (VIP) will be associated and used as public IP for ingress network traffic.
trans-unit.target: When you create an Application Gateway, an endpoint (VIP) will be associated and used as public IP for ingress network traffic.

trans-unit.source: The Application Gateway will route the HTTP traffic based on its configuration whether it's a virtual machine, cloud service, web app or an external IP address.
trans-unit.target: The Application Gateway will route the HTTP traffic based on its configuration whether it's a virtual machine, cloud service, web app or an external IP address.

trans-unit.source: HTTP layer 7 load balancing is useful for:
trans-unit.target: HTTP layer 7 load balancing is useful for:

trans-unit.source: Applications that require requests from the same user/client session to reach the same back-end VM.
trans-unit.target: Applications that require requests from the same user/client session to reach the same back-end VM.

trans-unit.source: Examples of this would be shopping cart apps and web mail servers.
trans-unit.target: Examples of this would be shopping cart apps and web mail servers.

trans-unit.source: Applications that want to free web server farms from SSL termination overhead.
trans-unit.target: Applications that want to free web server farms from SSL termination overhead.

trans-unit.source: Applications, such as CDN, that require multiple HTTP requests on the same long-running TCP connection to be routed/load balanced to different backend servers.
trans-unit.target: Applications, such as CDN, that require multiple HTTP requests on the same long-running TCP connection to be routed/load balanced to different backend servers.

trans-unit.source: Gateway sizes and instances
trans-unit.target: Gateway sizes and instances

trans-unit.source: Application Gateway is currently offered in 3 sizes: Small, Medium and Large.
trans-unit.target: Application Gateway is currently offered in 3 sizes: Small, Medium and Large.

trans-unit.source: Small instance sizes are intended for development and testing scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Small instance sizes are intended for development and testing scenarios.

trans-unit.source: You can create up to 10 application gateways per subscription and each application gateway can have up to 10 instances each.
trans-unit.target: You can create up to 10 application gateways per subscription and each application gateway can have up to 10 instances each.

trans-unit.source: Application Gateway load balancing as an Azure-managed service allows the provisioning of a layer 7 load balancer behind the Azure software load balancer.
trans-unit.target: Application Gateway load balancing as an Azure-managed service allows the provisioning of a layer 7 load balancer behind the Azure software load balancer.
